titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: In the afternoon we motored to Hartlepool, saw S
Hilda's church (where I noticed a tablet with a very flatterous epitaph in honour of the Evangelical Preacher,

), and such relics of the Bombardment as yet survive, and returned to Durham by the way of Wynyard. It was very cold, but the sun shone, & as we came back there were some very wonderful sunsetting effects.

called to see the Watsons. I told him that, if I could be of any service in assisting a peaceful settlement of the law suit between the University & the Charity Commission, I would be willing to do what lay in my power.
